required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nutritive Sucking Patterns in Premature Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Nutritive Sucking Patterns in Premature Infants: A Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: In this pilot trial, the investigators will determine the feasibility of monitoring nutritive sucking patterns to facilitate the transition from tube to oral feeding in extremely-low-birth weight (ELBW) infants

detailed_description.textblock: In this parallel-group randomized controlled trial, ELBW infants (birthweight < 1000 grams) will be randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio to either weekly reporting on objective measurements of sucking activity during oral feeding (intervention group) or usual care without information on sucking activity (control group).

primary_outcome.description: Time interval in days from introduction of oral feeding to full independent oral feeding

secondary_outcome.description: Age in days at the time of hospital discharge

secondary_outcome.measure: Growth rate during the transition from tube to oral feeding
Tube feeding events per day during the transition from tube to oral feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Daily count of tube feeding events

clinical_study.condition: Light-For-Dates Without Mention of Fetal Malnutrition, Unspecified

arm_group.arm_group_label: Reporting of sucking patterns captured by Instrumented Bottle
arm_group.description: Weekly reporting on objective measurements of sucking activity during oral feeding
Weekly reporting on traditional measurements of sucking activity during oral feeding (no objective measurements reported)

intervention.intervention_name: Reporting of sucking patterns captured by Instrumented Bottle
intervention.description: In the intervention group, data on nutritive sucking and feeding cues captured by the Instrumented Bottle will be made available to speech therapists to document the feeding session and provide written recommendations in their weekly report.
intervention.arm_group_label: Reporting of sucking patterns captured by Instrumented Bottle

intervention.description: In the control group, the information captured by the Instrumented Bottle will not be made available to speech therapists and therefore, will not be used to document a feeding session or provide weekly recommendations.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Birthweight < 1000 grams
- Gestational age < 32 weeks of gestation
- Full enteral feeding established before or on postnatal day 21
- Oral feeding initiated before or at 33 weeks of postmenstrual age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major congenital/chromosomal anomalies
- Patent ductus arteriosus causing significant cardiovascular symptoms
- History of necrotizing enterocolitis stage 2 or greater
